page.title: 10Memories CARSHALTON,SURREY.
page.content: As a child I used to play skipping with a long skipping rope stretched across the road in Culvers Way with my friends. We played quite happily for days on end without seeing one car to spoil our game. If we did it was quite an event. This type of game would be unthinkable now as there are large numbers of cars using Culvers Way. One especially nice treat for me as a child was when my father used to take me to Mill Lane - outside the Lord Palmerston Public House to see the Morris Dancers.This was a regular local treat for all the family, one that is sadly missed by me now. Carshalton Hand Laundry used to be between North House and West Street.As children we used to see all the sheets hanging out to dry on what appeared to be hundreds and hundreds of washing lines.The laundry no longer exists.
